title: Drawing, "Design for a Prison Courtyard, Seville, 1800, for "Fidelio," Act I, Scene 1", 1971–72
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, brown and orange watercolor, white gouache, graphite on gray paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: Elder
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, lower right: Fidelio - Act I, Scene 1
description: Prison courtyard with massive concrete walls at back and right side.  Two wooden gates at left side.  Concrete staircase leading to irongate at center right.  Platform above staircase.  Prison guard with rifle on platform overlooking man and woman at stage left.  Woman in white sitting in front of bucket.  Man wearing tie and vest standing in front of first wooden gate.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Prison Courtyard, Seville, 1800, for "Fidelio," Act I, Scene 1", 1971–72.Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, brown and orange watercolor, white gouache, graphite on gray paper. Gift of Eldon Elder Associates. 2000-13-1.
